review_title: A Place that you can explore all avenues of learning new skills
job_title: Microsoft Dynamics CRM Developer in Seattle, WA
pros: Great co-workers and leadership Friendly environment Feeling your work is making a difference leadership make time to hear you if you need to talk to higher up positions Amazing work life balance
cons: Not much room for grow Pay is not as big tech companies

job_title: Patient Care Representative in Seattle, WA
pros: flexible schedule billing and scheduling experience

job_title: Substance Use Disorder Counselor in Bellevue, WA
cons: Not enough time to be better.
Individual sites are kind of isolating

review_title: Like drinking from a fire hydrant when you're thirsty
pros: Good benefits, competitive salaries, First Hill location building is nice, well kept over all. Hard work, good CE benefits.
cons: Huge caseloads of high needs clients, lack of follow through from management, top management does not value counselors, and "you're replaceable" is standard. They don't supplement bus passes, and there is little to no parking available. Favoritism, nepotism and a type of racial discrimination. Written policies changed arbitrarily on daily or hourly whim of the CEO. Bullying is rewarded with promotion and protection. Star ratings related to certain populations. A white person will experience little forward opportunity, a person of color will be favored for inside promotion. It's blatant. Very stressful environment for employees causes a lot of in fighting.

pros: THS offers paid vacation, sick time and holidays. many of the co-workers are team players providing for a strong team environment
cons: THS Management does not support CD counselors, counseling staff is degraded and looked down on by management, and there are times when management staff will encounter a counseling staff member in  public, such as at a conference,  and refuse  to acknowledge the staff member and not even make eye contact.   The behaviors, attitudes and choices of the management is   not congruent with the agencies mission statement. the Staff nor  the clients are supported as the counseling staff is expected to carry a case load of over 100.  The Clients negative behavior is enabled by management they refuse to address illicit behavior that takes place on and around THS property.
Management does not care about staff. They will burn your soul by making you see 100 plus clients and spit you out, then move on to the next person.

review_title: It's so bad staff are leaving; even during a pandemic
job_title: Chemical Dependency Counselor in Seattle, WA
pros: The clients are amazing and you can learn a lot from the limited staff that is there.
cons: Massive caseloads, currently around 170 each. Only 2/6 clinicians left because everyone else quit because of how horribly the agency handled coronoavirus. No CD supervisors left, just the branch manager. Management just expects staff to do more and more. Raises are only 2.5% a year, but because of COVID they paused all raises.

review_title: Growing Organization Serving People in Need Across the Greater Seattle Area
job_title: Digital Marketing & Development Specialist in Seattle, WA
pros: Excellent co-workers and management who collaborate to best serve hundreds of patients. Staff really understand their missions is to save lives. Everyone works together to recover lives, restore health, and rebuild futures.
cons: Organizational change is a challenge for the culture and there are still some outdated systems in need of an upgrade.

pros: Policies are becoming more concrete and corporate is working on looking at more feedback from patients and employees.
cons: Gossip among supervisors and colleagues is not addressed, no direct supervision, trainings are not relevant to job positions or consistent between supervisors or even teams.

review_title: Compassionate care for those seeking to make life changes
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Seattle, WA
pros: Every professional there is dedicated to providing the bet possible care for those seeking to make positive life changes.
cons: Company is quickly growing and sometimes communication is lacking from upper management.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Seattle, WA
pros: Great people really make every day rewarding. Friendly work environment. The benefits package is unreal, especially for a Non-Profit.
cons: Limited growth and very limited income potential.

job_title: Director of Development in Seattle, WA
pros: Excellent mission serving people with co-occuring mental health and chemical dependency disorders.
cons: Some parts are siloed rather than integrated.
